summary:
Mount Etna is a really tall, active volcano in Sicily, Italy. It's the largest volcano in Europe and is always changing in height due to eruptions. Currently, it's over 11,000 feet tall! Etna is found where the African and Eurasian plates meet.

This volcano is famous for its constant activity and has been erupting for a very long time. The lava and ash create rich soil, making the area perfect for farming. Because of its size and activity, Etna is considered a special volcano by scientists and is even a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
title: Mount Etna
